page.title: 19GOLF COURSES
page.content:
FOUNDED IN 1905, IT HAS 700 MEMBERS OF WHOM 150 ARE LADIES. THERE ARE 18 HOLES PLUS A 19A WHICH IS USED WHEN A HOLE IS OUT OF USE. THE TOTAL LENGTH OF THE COURSE IS 6,000 YARDS.
THE FAIRWAYS ARE AN AVERAGE OF 18 YARDS IN WIDTH. HAZARDS INCLUDE BUNKERS, RIVERS, DITCHES AND TREES. THE COURSE RECORD IS CURRENTLY 66.
THE NORMAL SET OF GOLF CLUBS CONTAINS 14 CLUBS. THE PUTTER IS THE CLUB MOST COMMONLY USED AND THE SAND WEDGE IS THE LEAST FREQUENTLY USED. THE PRESENT CLUB CHAMPION IS STEVEN RICHARDSON WHO PLAYS OFF A HANDICAP OF ONE.
